item.title: Capturing Live Network Traffic from a Kubernetes Pod
item.description:
Capturing Live Network Traffic from a Kubernetes Pod Link to heading

Occasionally, you need to troubleshoot network behavior inside a Kubernetes pod â€” maybe you’re chasing a DNS issue, testing service connectivity, or inspecting strange application traffic. tcpdump is still one of the best tools for this, but pods are intentionally minimal, and most containers won’t have it installed.

This post shows a quick and dirty way to run a live packet capture from inside a pod, without modifying your application container image.
